headline.main: Vigils in Ireland for Indian Woman Who Died After Being Denied Abortion

docs.abstract: The death of an Indian woman who was denied an abortion in Ireland last month during a long miscarriage prompted more than a thousand protesters to rally outside the Irish Parliament in Dublin on Wednesday night.
docs.snippet: The death of an Indian woman who was denied an abortion in Ireland last month during a long miscarriage prompted more than a thousand protesters to rally outside the Irish Parliament in Dublin on Wednesday night.

docs.lead_paragraph: A girl’s pregnancy led to her being ousted from her home.

headline.main: Told to Leave Her Home, a Teenage Mother Finds Help and Seeks Reconciliation
headline.print_headline: Told to Leave Her Home, a Teenage Mother Finds Help and Seeks Reconciliation

headline.print_headline: Antibiotics Are a Gift to Be Handled With Care

docs.abstract: Spurred by new realizations about the risks of breeding resistant bacteria, pediatricians have cut back on prescribing antibiotics.
docs.snippet: Spurred by new realizations about the risks of breeding resistant bacteria, pediatricians have cut back on prescribing antibiotics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Josmery Batista, who received a diagnosis of Stage 4 breast cancer last year, is so enfeebled by the effects of chemotherapy that sometimes she is unable to hold her infant son.

headline.main: Battling Breast Cancer, Single Mother Takes Strength From Her Children
headline.print_headline: Battling Breast Cancer, Single Mother Takes Strength From Her Children

docs.lead_paragraph: As a reproductive health bill advances in the Philippines, it is peak baby-delivery season, with women and their newborns are sleeping two to a bed at one Manila hospital.

headline.seo: Manila Hospital Awaits Reproductive Health Bill’s Fate
headline.main: Manila Hospital, No Stranger to Stork, Awaits Reproductive Health Bill’s Fate
headline.print_headline: Manila Hospital, No Stranger to Stork, Awaits Reproductive Health Bill’s Fate

docs.abstract: Reproductive health bill is advancing in Philippines that would require sex education and subsidize birth control; meanwhile, it is peak baby-delivery season and one overcrowded Manila hospital is coping with women and their newborns sleeping two to a bed.
docs.snippet: As a reproductive health bill advances in the Philippines, it is peak baby-delivery season, with women and their newborns are sleeping two to a bed at one Manila hospital.

docs.lead_paragraph: The infants the vaccine was given to had only about a third fewer infections than a control group, but researchers said they wanted to press on, assuming they keep getting financial support.

headline.seo: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Produces Disappointing Results in Clinical Trial
headline.main: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Gives Disappointing Results
headline.print_headline: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Gives Disappointing Results

docs.abstract: Latest clinical trial of world’s leading malaria vaccine candidate produces disappointing results, with infants who received it having only about a third fewer infections than a control group; vaccine, known as RTS, S or Mosquirix, is produced by GlaxoSmithKline.
docs.snippet: The infants the vaccine was given to had only about a third fewer infections than a control group, but researchers said they wanted to press on, assuming they keep getting financial support.

docs.lead_paragraph: Voters in Florida and Montana sent a message to politicians who might want to attack women’s reproductive rights.
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds Florida voters for rejecting amendment to State Constitution that would prohibit abortion coverage as part of state workers' health care plans and Medicaid recipients; maintains even while Montana voters approved parental notification mandate for abortion for minors, passage does not mean voters support broader government interference with women's reproductive choices.
docs.snippet: Voters in Florida and Montana sent a message to politicians who might want to attack women’s reproductive rights.

docs.lead_paragraph: If Republicans meddle with the freedom of choice and sexual orientations of Americans they will go on losing.
docs.snippet: If Republicans meddle with the freedom of choice and sexual orientations of Americans they will go on losing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.

headline.seo: Women’s Issues Were a Problem for G.O.P.
headline.main: Senate Races Expose Extent of Republicans’ Gender Gap
headline.print_headline: Senate Races Expose Extent Of Republicans’ Gender Gap

docs.abstract: Comments by two Republican Senate candidates concerning pregnancies that result from rape are said to have derailed party's hopes of gaining seats in the Senate; shortfall highlights gender gap Republican Party has with female voters as the controversial remarks on rape and abortion drowned out other messages.
docs.snippet: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.
